STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 17, 2019
Girlstown Foundation
PO Box 727
Belleville, MI 48111
RE: License #: CB820201144
Guiding Harbor
525 Huron River Drive
Belleville, MI 48111
Dear Ms. Trotter:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on May 15,
2019. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and ISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions at (248) 860-4532.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-4532
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(2) The annual reevaluation shall include a determination and
assessment of all of the following:
(d) Compliance with the licensing rules for foster homes.
One of four reevaluations was missing a 3080 at the time of
the annual inspection.
R 400.12404 Placement.
(7) An agency shall document, in the child's record, within 7
calendar days after placement, the information specified in R
400.12417(1) and all of the following information:
(a - i)
One of four foster children placed had no placement
outline.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the child's
record before a change of placement occurs:
(a – j)
There was no action summary (DHHS 69-B) documenting a
replacement on 3/13/19 for one of four foster children.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
4

(c) A physical examination for each child as follows, unless a
greater frequency is medically indicated:
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months before
placement or a new physical examination shall be completed
within 30 calendar days after placement.
For one of four children, the 30-month well child exam was
missing one or more pages and was not uploaded into
MISACWIS.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of eight USPs was completed 7 days late.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(3) When case responsibility changes from 1 child placing
agency to another child placing agency, a modified service plan
must be completed within 30 calendar days of the change in
agency responsibility if no other plan is done within 30 days.
The plan shall address why the agency responsibility changed
and whether there are any modifications to existing service
plans.
A modified service plan was required and not completed for
one of four foster children.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 days after
5

placement in independent living and updated at least once
every 90 days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420.
For three of three closed independent living records,
timeframes of service and social work contacts were
missing between the end of the last USP completed and the
te the youth was terminated from independent living.
R 400.12511 Independent living termination.
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living services
for a youth, the agency shall document all of the following
information in the case record within 30 calendar days of
termination of its services:
(a - d)
For three of three discharged independent living youth,
the DHHS-69 was used, which does not align with the
licensing rules. The DHHS 69-B should have been used.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.18 Relative Foster Parent Licensing Timeliness
Relatives are to be licensed within 180 days of application
Five of six enrolled relatives were not licensed within 180 days.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
6

FOM 722.08C – Caregiver signatures on PATPs
Two of nine PATPs did not have the caregiver’s signature
FOM 722-6H – Quarterly unannounced visits
Quarterly unannounced visits were not made in two of eight quarters.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
R 400.12325(3) (b)(ii) License recommendation – CAPs must be completed within six
months. A foster parent was given the full six months to complete two simple CAPs.
For simple remedies, a shorter timeframe is recommended.
R 400.121327 (5) (d) Special evaluation – Document persons interviewed
Licensing staff do not need to interview every child in the household unless those
children may be able to provide information relevant to the investigation.
R 400.12418 (3) Modified Service plans - must include why case responsibility changed
from one agency to another and whether there were any changes to the existing service
plan. The agency’s Modified Service Plan template does not include the above
requirements. It is suggested these prompts be added to their template.
R 400.12417 (1) (g) Foster Parent Information – the agency uses the Intake Respite
Replacement form to notify foster parents of a child’s history and behavior prior to
placement. It is recommended the agency add a date to the signature lines and a
prompt to include (g) circumstances necessitating the current replacement.
ANALYST’S FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1 No concerns
Safety Alert #2 No concerns
Safety Alert #3 No concerns
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse, neglect or corporal
punishment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted one corrective action plan for the 2018 Renewal
Inspection during this licensing period with the following violations:
R 400.12327 (5) (c) & (f) Special Evaluation
7

R 400.12413 (1) (c ) Medical and dental care policy
R 400.12418 (2) (b) Development of service plans (repeated in 2019)
R 400.12509 (3) (o) Independent living record (repeated in 2019)
R 400.12510 (1) & (2) Independent living contract
ISEP 6.18 Relative Foster Parent Licensing Timeliness (repeated in 2019)
ISEP 6.30 Supervisory Oversight
FOM 722-6H Quarterly Unannounced Visits (repeated in 2019)
FOM 722-06I Monthly Sibling Visits
FOM 722.08 Supervisory Signature on Service Plans within 14 days
FOM 722.06B Quarterly FTMs
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
May 17, 2019
________________________________________
Deborah Will Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 31, 2019
